passages.text: NVIDIA Corp. NVDA| \(181.41\) Outperform|Target Price/Base Case: \(14.00\) Earnings Report
52-Week Range$86.62 - $184.48Market Capitalization (B)$4,435Enterprise Value (B)$4,392Dividend Yield0.0%Net Cash/Share$1.78Shares Outstanding (M)24,400

Buyers of weakness: We think NVDA's \(3\%\) decline is aftermarket trading is due to the \(1\%\) decline in DC compute and higher OpEx outlook. However, backing out the \(\) 4.6\(bn in shipments to China in 1Q and\) \ \(0.6bn\) in 2Q, we estimate DC compute increased by a healthy \(12\%\) QQ. We also view the higher OpEx as a reflection of NVDA's goal to prosecute a broadening set of opportunities in emerging Al markets. Our checks continue to indicate users view NVDA as the Al ecosystem solution of choice, and that Cloud CapEx accelerates in 2025. At a P/E of \(34x\) against the backdrop of accelerating cloud CapEx, we view the aftermarket weakness as a particular buying opportunity, and reiterate NVDA as a top pick.

DC Compute \(+12\%\) QQ ex China. JulQ DC revs of \(\) 41.1\(bn 79bps below consensus expectations, and Data Center Compute revs declined - 1% QQ. More importantly, ex - shipments of H20 GPUs to China, NVDA DC compute revs increased by 12% QQ. NVDA estimates Blackwell Ultra shipments exceeding\) \ \(10bn\) in JulQ (fastest product ramp in NVDA history) and expects Blackwell Ultra units to grow through the year. It also noted that some customers continue ordering Blackwell systems and expects to ship both B200 and B300- based solutions. Networking revenues grew \(46\%\) QQ driven by growth in NVL- 72- system NVLink products as well Ethernet and InfiniBand.
FY26 update: NVDA expects to exit the year with non- GAAP GMs in the mid- \(70\%\) range. OpEx growth is expected to be in the high- \(30\%\) range vs prior guidance of mid- 30s

JulQ EPS Beat. JulQ Revs of \(\) 46.7\(bn (+6\%\) QQ/ \(56\%\) YY) beat consensus by 150bps. Gross margins of \(72.7\%\) (or \(72.3\%\) if adjusted for H20 related releases) was above consensus. Non- GAAP EPS of \(\) 1.05\(beat consensus by\) \ \(0.04 / 4\%\)

OctQ Revs/EPS Beat. OctQ- 25 Revs outlook of \(\) 54bn(+16\%\(QQ/\) +54\%\(YY) at the midpoint beat consensus by 110bps. GM guide of\) 73.5\%\(was 70bps above consensus. Non - GAAP OpEx outlook of\) \ \(4.2bn\) was 56bps above consensus. We estimate non- GAAP EPS of \(\) 1.24\(is\) \ \(0.04 / 3\%\) above consensus.
Links to Related Research:

NVDA: JulQ EPS Preview: We Are Buyers into the Print NVDA: H20s OK Again? Reiterate Top Pick NVDA: GTC Paris Takes: NVDA Remains Top Semi Core Holding NVDA: AprQ EPS: Expanding Demand - Still Early in the Tectonic Shift
Although NVDA Compute Data Center declined \(1\%\) QQ in JulQ- 25 when excluding H- 20 headwind the revenues grew \(12\%\) still below \(46\%\) QQ growth in Networking
Figure 1: NVDA Compute Grew \(12\%\) QQ ex-H20
Source: Company Data, Evercore ISI Research, Visible Alpha
Figure 2: Latest T1/2 CSPs Channel Checks Indicate Strong Demand for NVDA Blackwell Products

SourceQuoteTier 2 CSPThis year, it's all Grace Blackwell 200. We're working day-in, day-out, deploying it, integrating it and then waiting for the next shipment to comeTier 1 CSPOrders largely caught up to expectations 6 months ago, but demand grew over that period. Deploying material quantity of racks/Q but largely in cooler regionsTier 1 CSPThey have a software that is called Dynamo software where it allows you to now sequentially parallelize the job with taking each sequence on one GPU, so it does not have to wait anymore, even during inference. This is why I say you still need the large models and specifically the newer models from Nvidia and this is why I don't see them slowing down at all to tell you the truth.Tier 1 CSPAvailability of GB200 was disappointing. A lot of cloud providers are waiting for GB300. I believe by at least installing it by early next year, end of this year. This is why you see a surge on H100 because to your point, the demand doesn't wait, but H100 is very cheap now today compared to a GB200. Once GB300 is ready, you jump directly to GB300. We're taking H200 now as far as I can tell.Tier 1 CSPModels are getting more complex. We used to have a few years ago just 40 billion. Now there's trillion, billion parameters. The thing is you need higher-end GPU systems like Grace Blackwell 200, NVL72 racks or the new UltraClusters for Trainium, if you want to train these in a decent amount of time, so you can monetise the model.Tier 1 CSPGrace Blackwell 200 is super-hot. People want that, but they want it more for training these large-scale models. There is also a trend for virtualization Grace Blackwell system to carve that up though for multi-tenancy... you could leverage these Grace Blackwell power in a smaller footprint to get more tenants.Tier 1 CSPWe believe Google is the biggest user of its own chips for internal inferencing consumption, at about 65%-70%, with Amazon following at about 25% internal chips for internal inferencing consumption. We believe Microsoft, Oracle Cloud, Apple and Meta are heavily dependent on NVidia.
Source:Evercore ISI Research

JuIQ Revs of \(\) 46.7bn(+6\%\(QQ/56\%\mathrm{YY})\)beat consensus by 150bps. Gross margins of \(72.7\%\) (or \(72.3\%\) if adjusted for H20 related releases) was above consensus. Non-GAAP EPS of \(\) 1.05\(beat consensus by\) \ \(0.04 / 4\%\) .

OctQ- 25 Revs outlook of \(\) 54bn(+16\%\(QQ/ + 54\%\) YY) at the midpoint beat consensus by 110bps. GM guide of \(73.5\%\) was 70bps above consensus. Non- GAAP OpEx outlook of \(\) 4.2bn\(was 56bps above consensus. We estimate non- GAAP EPS of\) \ \(1.24\) is \(\) 0.04 / 3\%\(above consensus.
NVDA beat our EPS est by \(\) 0.03\(on higher revs and better GM\)
A/R DSO of 46 days decreased 8 days QQ and increased 11 days YY
Inventories at 107 days increased 47 days QQ and 23 days YY
Figure 3: NVDA Results
Source: Company Data, Evercore ISI Research, FactSet

NVDA expects modest sequential growth across all of our platforms. In Data Center, it noted continued ramp of Blackwell to be partially offset by a decline in China revenue (the outlook reflects a loss in H20 revenue of \(\sim\) 8bn in JulQ)

Of the 36 respondents, \(25\%\) expect NVDA 2025 DC GPU revenues to be \(\) 160bn\(26%\) in Apr, \(14\%\) in Jan), followed by \(22\%\) for \(\) 190bn\(10%\) in Apr), \(17\%\) for \(\) 170bn\(10%\) in Apr), \(14\%\) for \(\) 180bn\(26%\) in Apr), \(14\%\) for \(> \mathbb{S}200bn\) (13% in Apr) and \(8\%\) for \( \mathbb{S}220bn\) followed by \(24\%\) for \(\) 200bn\(22%\) for \(\) 210bn\(14%\) for \(\) 180bn\(and\) 11\%\(for\) \ \(190bn\)
This seems to suggest buy- side bogey of \(\) 207bn\$
Long Only investor bogey closer to \(\) 203bn\(vs Hedge Fund\) \ \(211bn\)

Consensus forecasts NVDA EPS expanding by \(40\%\) in C26 vs C25, which translates to a PEG ratio of 0.9x
Figure 15: NVDA Looks Attractive on PE vs EPS Growth Metric
Source: Company Data, Evercore ISI Research, FactSet as of 27-Aug-25
NVDA is trading at 34x PE, in the lower half of the AI stocks
Figure 16: NVDA Multiple Expanded over the Past Quarter, Remains In Bottom Half of AI Plays
Source: Company Data, Evercore ISI Research, FactSet as of 27-Aug-25
We note that on YY growth deceleration, AVGO saw deceleration play out ahead of NVDA. We expect NVDA PE multiple to improve as it sees YY revs growth rate bottoming in JulQ- 25
Figure 17: NVDA Revenue Deceleration Has Largely Played Out
Source: Company Data, Evercore ISI Research, FactSet
Figure 18: As Is the Case With AVGO
Source: Company Data, Evercore ISI Research, FactSet
NVDA is trading at 34x NTM PE multiple compared to 36x 9yr median - a 5% discount.
On a relative basis NVDA is trading at 24% discount to median relative NTM PE
Figure 19: NVDA Relative PE 5% Below 9yr Median
Source:FactSet,EVR ISI
NVDA share price increased 42% over the past 12 months, outperforming SPX by 26%
Figure 20: NVDA Outperformed SPX by 3% in the last Month and 26% In the Past Year
Source:Company Data,Evercore ISI Research,FactSet as of 27-Aug-25
In the chart on the right, we show peak S&P 500 contribution across the past several Computing Eras, namely:
IBM 7% in 1972 INTC (4%), MSFT (5%), DELL (1%), and CSCO (4%) a combined 14% in 2000 AAPL 8% in 2012 (but only \~20- 25% share not 80% share typically seen)
So in general, we've seen full- stack compute ecosystems capture 7%- 14% of the S&P 500
By comparison, NVDA is only 8% today - and we see a path to 12%- 16% over time
Figure 21: Past Computing Ecosystems Captured 7%-14% of SPX 5-to-15 Years into Respective Compute Eras
Source: Company Data, Evercore ISI Research, FactSet, as of 27-Aug-25
Cloud Bookings grew \(39\%\) YY (+12% QQ) in JunQ vs \(29\%\) YY in MarQ and \(24\%\) YY growth in DecQ
Figure 22: Cloud TTM Bookings Accelerated to \(39\%\) YY Growth in JunQ-25
Source: Company Data, Evercore ISI Research
We forecast T1+T2+T3 cloud CapEx to increase by \(72\%\) in 2025, and acceleration from \(56\%\) in 2024

We apply a P/E ratio of 30x our 2030 EPS power of \(\) 10.48\(to get\) \ \(314\) in 2030, which we discount back to get a \(\) 214\(one year price target.\)

Competition from traditional semi companies like AMD and Intel, as well as from customers like Amazon and Google which have started making their own chips. Supply risks associated with a concentrated supply chain based largely in Taiwan, Korea and SE Asia

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:

Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. In Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances. Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, In Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
